claim.statement: social distancing measures introduced by governments during the 2020 pandemic reduced the mobility in the concerned cities.
hypothesis: H*: The introduction of social distancing measures is associated with a decrease in mobility

method.description: The study analyzed mobility data from 41 cities to evaluate the impact of social distancing measures. Mobility data from the Citymapper Mobility Index (CMI) was used, covering the period from March 2, 2020, to March 26, 2020. The effect of these measures was estimated using a multilevel mixed-effects linear regression model.
steps: Download mobility data from Citymapper Mobility Index from March 2, 2020, to March 26, 2020.
Tabulate social distancing measures from official government and media websites.
Classify cities based on the intensity of social distancing measures.
Estimate the effect of time and social distancing measures using multilevel mixed-effects linear regression model.

results.summary: The median mobility decreased significantly in the analyzed period, largely attributed to the introduction of social distancing measures. The measures resulted in an average daily mobility decrease by 3.4% and an additional reduction of 23% in mobility on the implementation of these measures.

numerical_results.outcome_name: mobility decrease due to social distancing

metadata.original_paper_title: COVID-19 related social distancing measures and reduction in city mobility
